abstract: In a letter to Dell shareholders, Carl C. Icahn and his partner, Southeastern Asset Management, proposed giving shareholders a warrant to buy a share in the struggling computer company at $20 apiece for every four shares that they tender, in addition to buying back 1.1 billion shares at $14 each.
snippet: In a letter to Dell shareholders, Carl C. Icahn and his partner, Southeastern Asset Management, proposed giving shareholders a warrant to buy a share in the struggling computer company at $20 apiece for every four shares that they tender, in addit...
lead_paragraph: Carl C. Icahn lived up to his word on Friday, offering a sweetener to his alternative to a $24.4 billion leveraged buyout of Dell Inc. by adding a warrant to his stock buyback plan.

headline.main: As Promised, Icahn Adds to His Bid for Dell

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
